From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From contacte +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kun.təkˈta]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kon.təkˈta]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kon.takˈtaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

contactar (first-person singular present contacto, first-person singular preterite contactí, past participle contactat)

  1. to contact [with amb]
    Com puc contactar amb vosaltres? ― How can I contact you?

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • contacte

Further reading

[edit]
  • “contactar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “contactar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “contactar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • contatar (Brazil)

Etymology

[edit]

From contacto (“contact”) +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.takˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.takˈta(h)], /kõ.ta.kiˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.ta.kiˈta(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.takˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.takˈta(h)], /kõ.ta.kiˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.ta.kiˈta(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kõ.takˈta(ɾ)/, /kõ.ta.kiˈta(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kõ.takˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.takˈta(χ)], /kõ.ta.kiˈta(ʁ)/ [kõ.ta.kiˈta(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.takˈta(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.tɐˈktaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.tɐˈktaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.tɐˈkta.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: con‧tac‧tar

Verb

[edit]

contactar (first-person singular present contacto, first-person singular preterite contactei, past participle contactado)

  1. (transitive or intransitive) to contact (establish communication with) [transitive or with com ‘someone’]
    Synonym: entrar em contacto
    Como é que o posso contactar? ― How can I reach you?

Usage notes

[edit]

In Brazil, both the forms contactar and contatar are used. The latter is notably consistent with contato.

Conjugation

Further reading

[edit]
  • “contactar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “contactar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “contactar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “contactar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “contactar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From contacto +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kontaɡˈtaɾ/ [kõn̪.t̪aɣ̞ˈt̪aɾ]
  • Audio (Venezuela):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: con‧tac‧tar

Verb

[edit]

contactar (first-person singular present contacto, first-person singular preterite contacté, past participle contactado)

  1. (intransitive) to contact, to reach out to [with con ‘someone’]
    Contactaré contigo.
    I'll contact you.

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
